none: Northwestern University Marching Band Compilation Video, 1999
Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). School of Music (Contributor)
Northwestern University Video Cassette Collection--Northwestern University Marching Band Highlights
Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). School of Music
Williams, John, 1932- Olympic fanfare and theme
Williams, John, 1932- Raiders of the lost ark
Raiders of the lost ark (Motion picture)

Highlights from the 1999 Northwestern University Marching Band season. Highlights begin with the pregame performance at the November 11, 1999 Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Michigan State Spartans at Ryan Field in Evanston, Illinois. The pregame performances include "Go U Fanfare," "Victory for MSU," and "America the Beautiful." Mallory Thompson conducts the National Anthem, and then "Go U Northwestern" is performed. The halftime show from the October 2, 1999 game against the Minnesota Golden Gophers include the "1812 Overture." The halftime show from the October 16, 1999 Homecoming game against the Iowa Hawkeyes features music by composer John Williams including "Olympic Fanfare" and music from "Raiders of the Lost Ark." The NUMB Alums join the band for music from "Star Wars." The halftime show from the October 30, 1999 game against the Wisconsin Badgers features performances of songs by the band Chicago including "Hard To Say I'm Sorry." Halftime performances from the November 13, 1999 game against the Michigan State Spartans include "Malague単a" and "March of the Steelmen." For the halftime show during the November 20, 1999 game against the Fighting Illini in Champaign, Illinois the Northwestern University Marching Band performs "Malague単a." A slide show featuring memorable moments from the 1999 season follows the performance at Illinois.

The recordings on this web site are provided for use by Northwestern University students, faculty, staff and guests. Further distribution and/or any commercial use of these recordings from this site is strictly prohibited. Please contact specialcollections@northwestern.edu for more information
Northwestern University Libraries Digital Collections API
Homepage at Northwestern University Libraries Digital Collections

Digitization of this collection was funded by a generous gift from the family of Music professor and bandleader John Phillip Paynter, who began his musical studies at Northwestern, graduating with a Bachelor of Music degree in 1950 and a Master's in Theory and Composition in 1951. Upon graduation, Paynter joined NU's faculty as the Director of the Marching Band. During his career at Northwestern, Paynter taught classes in band music, conducting, and arranging.
